parameters.functionCode:
const emails = [
    $json["mainEmail"],
    $json["thirdPartyEmail01"],
    $json["thirdPartyEmail02"],
    $json["thirdPartyEmail03"],
    $json["thirdPartyEmail04"]
].filter(email => email && email.trim() !== "").map(email => email.toLowerCase().trim()); // Normalize emails

const uniqueEmails = [...new Set(emails)]; // Remove duplicates

return uniqueEmails.map(email => ({ json: { email } }));

parameters.content:
- Test with nested loop again (with option > reset toggle on)

- If no valid email, first check summary, about, bio, etc. If found then validate

- Create notfication when email credits run low

values.content: You are a helpful and intelligent assistant.

Your job is to clean up the URL provided.

#Examples

Examples Input:
https://www.hello.com/es
https://hello.com/es
www.hello.com

Examples Output:
hello.com
hello.com
hello.com

#Output
In JSON format, item called "cleanedUrl"

parameters.content:
## Validate Scraped Email
Count 3 attempts with HTTP request timeout, then try next email address
